name: The Little Bike That Could
description:
This is a bicycle simulation game featuring advanced bike physics.

The player uses gamepad to set the lean angle, and the game will use the handle bars to reach that lean angle.

A full and accurate physics simulation, running at 240Hz, gives the game a realistic feel.

Separate control over front and rear brakes gives the rider the possibility of doing stoppies, and with lean backward, wheelies are possible.

And with ramps, 360 flips, front and back are possible too.

CONTROLS

LEFT BUMPER: CAMERA

LEFT STICK: SET SPEED

RIGHT STICK: LEAN FORWARD/BACKWARD, LEFT/RIGHT.

LEFT TRIGGER: REAR BRAKE

RIGHT TRIGGER: FRONT BRAKE

REQUIREMENTS MS WINDOWS

64 bit, OpenGL 3.2 or higher. Visual Studio 2015 redistributable files: https://www.microsoft.com/en-ca/download/details.a...

Gamepad (SDL2 supported) strongly recommended.

REQUIREMENTS LINUX

64bit x64 only.

Tested on Ubuntu 16.04

Gamepad (SDL2 supported) strongly recommended.
